item.title: Criando uma API REST em Python com Flask
item.description:
<img src="https://sidneiweber.com.br/criando-api-rest-em-python-com-flask/featured-image.png" alt="featured image" referrerpolicy="no-referrer"><h2 id="o-que-é-uma-api-rest" class="heading-element"><span>O que é uma API REST</span>
 <a href="#o-que-%c3%a9-uma-api-rest" class="heading-mark">
 <svg class="octicon octicon-link" viewBox="0 0 16 16" version="1.1" width="16" height="16" aria-hidden="true"><path d="m7.775 3.275 1.25-1.25a3.5 3.5 0 1 1 4.95 4.95l-2.5 2.5a3.5 3.5 0 0 1-4.95 0 .751.751 0 0 1 .018-1.042.751.751 0 0 1 1.042-.018 1.998 1.998 0 0 0 2.83 0l2.5-2.5a2.002 2.002 0 0 0-2.83-2.83l-1.25 1.25a.751.751 0 0 1-1.042-.018.751.751 0 0 1-.018-1.042Zm-4.69 9.64a1.998 1.998 0 0 0 2.83 0l1.25-1.25a.751.751 0 0 1 1.042.018.751.751 0 0 1 .018 1.042l-1.25 1.25a3.5 3.5 0 1 1-4.95-4.95l2.5-2.5a3.5 3.5 0 0 1 4.95 0 .751.751 0 0 1-.018 1.042.751.751 0 0 1-1.042.018 1.998 1.998 0 0 0-2.83 0l-2.5 2.5a1.998 1.998 0 0 0 0 2.83Z"></path></svg>
 </a>
</h2><p>Uma API REST (Representational State Transfer ou Transferência de Estado Representacional) é um tipo de arquitetura para a construção serviços. Essa abordagem permite a comunicação entre os sistemas usando os protocolos padrão da web, como HTTP.</p>
<p><figure><img loading="lazy" src="https://sidneiweber.com.br/criando-api-rest-em-python-com-flask/img.png" alt="REST API" srcset="https://sidneiweber.com.br/criando-api-rest-em-python-com-flask/img.png?size=small, https://sidneiweber.com.br/criando-api-rest-em-python-com-flask/img.png?size=medium 1.5x, https://sidneiweber.com.br/criando-api-rest-em-python-com-flask/img.png?size=large 2x" data-title="REST API" style="--width: 700px;--aspect-ratio: 700 / 329;background: url(/images/loading.min.svg) no-repeat center;" onload="this.title=this.dataset.title;for(const i of ['style', 'data-title','onerror','onload']){this.removeAttribute(i);}this.dataset.lazyloaded='';" onerror="this.title=this.dataset.title;for(const i of ['style', 'data-title','onerror','onload']){this.removeAttribute(i);}"/><figcaption class="image-caption">REST API</figcaption>
 </figure></p>
<p>Principais características de uma API REST:</p>
<ul>
<li>
<p><strong>Arquitetura cliente-servidor</strong>: A comunicação ocorre entre um cliente (como um navegador web ou um aplicativo móvel) e um servidor, seguindo o modelo de requisição e resposta.</p>
</li>
<li>
<p><strong>Estado Representacional</strong>: Os recursos (dados ou funcionalidades) são representados por meio de URLs acessíveis através do HTTP, e o estado do recurso é transferido entre o cliente e o servidor nas requisições e respostas.</p>
</li>
<li>
<p><strong>Operações HTTP</strong>: As operações HTTP (GET, POST, PUT, DELETE, etc.) são utilizadas para manipular os recursos. Por exemplo, GET é usado para recuperar recursos, POST para criar novos recursos, PUT para atualizar recursos existentes e DELETE para remover recursos.</p>
</li>
<li>
<p><strong>Sem estado (Stateless)</strong>: Cada requisição do cliente para o servidor deve conter todas as informações necessárias para o servidor entender e processar a requisição, sem depender de nenhum estado mantido no servidor entre as requisições.</p>
</li>
<li>
<p><strong>Interoperabilidade</strong>: As APIs REST são independentes de linguagem de programação e plataforma, o que significa que podem ser desenvolvidas e consumidas por uma variedade de tecnologias.</p>
</li>
<li>
<p><strong>Formatos de Representação de Dados</strong>: As APIs REST geralmente suportam vários formatos de dados, como JSON (JavaScript Object Notation) e XML (eXtensible Markup Language), para representar os recursos transferidos entre o cliente e o servidor.</p>
</li>
</ul>
<h2 id="exemplo-prático" class="heading-element"><span>Exemplo prático</span>
 <a href="#exemplo-pr%c3%a1tico" class="heading-mark">
 <svg class="octicon octicon-link" viewBox="0 0 16 16" version="1.1" width="16" height="16" aria-hidden="true"><path d="m7.775 3.275 1.25-1.25a3.5 3.5 0 1 1 4.95 4.95l-2.5 2.5a3.5 3.5 0 0 1-4.95 0 .751.751 0 0 1 .018-1.042.751.751 0 0 1 1.042-.018 1.998 1.998 0 0 0 2.83 0l2.5-2.5a2.002 2.002 0 0 0-2.83-2.83l-1.25 1.25a.751.751 0 0 1-1.042-.018.751.751 0 0 1-.018-1.042Zm-4.69 9.64a1.998 1.998 0 0 0 2.83 0l1.25-1.25a.751.751 0 0 1 1.042.018.751.751 0 0 1 .018 1.042l-1.25 1.25a3.5 3.5 0 1 1-4.95-4.95l2.5-2.5a3.5 3.5 0 0 1 4.95 0 .751.751 0 0 1-.018 1.042.751.751 0 0 1-1.042.018 1.998 1.998 0 0 0-2.83 0l-2.5 2.5a1.998 1.998 0 0 0 0 2.83Z"></path></svg>
 </a>
</h2><h3 id="virtualenv" class="heading-element"><span>VirtualEnv</span>
 <a href="#virtualenv" class="heading-mark">
 <svg class="octicon octicon-link" viewBox="0 0 16 16" version="1.1" width="16" height="16" aria-hidden="true"><path d="m7.775 3.275 1.25-1.25a3.5 3.5 0 1 1 4.95 4.95l-2.5 2.5a3.5 3.5 0 0 1-4.95 0 .751.751 0 0 1 .018-1.042.751.751 0 0 1 1.042-.018 1.998 1.998 0 0 0 2.83 0l2.5-2.5a2.002 2.002 0 0 0-2.83-2.83l-1.25 1.25a.751.751 0 0 1-1.042-.018.751.751 0 0 1-.018-1.042Zm-4.69 9.64a1.998 1.998 0 0 0 2.83 0l1.25-1.25a.751.751 0 0 1 1.042.018.751.751 0 0 1 .018 1.042l-1.25 1.25a3.5 3.5 0 1 1-4.95-4.95l2.5-2.5a3.5 3.5 0 0 1 4.95 0 .751.751 0 0 1-.018 1.042.751.751 0 0 1-1.042.018 1.998 1.998 0 0 0-2.83 0l-2.5 2.5a1.998 1.998 0 0 0 0 2.83Z"></path></svg>
 </a>
</h3><p>Para facilitar precisamos ter instalado o virtualenv para Python.</p>
<p>Isso faz com que as dependências sejam sempre instaladas em uma virtualenv específica, não mais no sistema operacional. A partir daí, cada projeto executa seu código-fonte utilizando sua virtualenv própria.</p>
<p>No Debian/Ubuntu podemos instalar com o seguinte comando:</p>
<div class="highlight"><div class="chroma">
<table class="lntable"><tr><td class="lntd">
<pre tabindex="0" class="chroma"><code><span class="lnt">1
</span></code></pre></td>
<td class="lntd">
<pre tabindex="0" class="chroma"><code class="language-shell" data-lang="shell"><span class="line"><span class="cl">apt install virtualenv</span></span></code></pre></td></tr></table>
</div>
</div><p>Ou podemos utilizar o próprio pip do Python</p>
<div class="highlight"><div class="chroma">
<table class="lntable"><tr><td class="lntd">
<pre tabindex="0" class="chroma"><code><span class="lnt">1
</span></code></pre></td>
<td class="lntd">
<pre tabindex="0" class="chroma"><code class="language-shell" data-lang="shell"><span class="line"><span class="cl">pip install virtualenv</span></span></code></pre></td></tr></table>
</div>
</div><p>Vamos criar um virtualenv chamado venv. Existem duas formas de fazermos isso, utilizando o próprio virtualenv ou com o python diretamente:</p>
<div class="highlight"><div class="chroma">
<table class="lntable"><tr><td class="lntd">
<pre tabindex="0" class="chroma"><code><span class="lnt">1
</span><span class="lnt">2
</span><span class="lnt">3
</span></code></pre></td>
<td class="lntd">
<pre tabindex="0" class="chroma"><code class="language-shell" data-lang="shell"><span class="line"><span class="cl">virtualenv venv
</span></span><span class="line"><span class="cl"><span class="c1"># Ou utilizando o python com opção -m</span>
</span></span><span class="line"><span class="cl">python3 -m venv .</span></span></code></pre></td></tr></table>
</div>
</div><p>Para ativar o virtualenv criado utilizamos o comando source:</p>
<div class="highlight"><div class="chroma">
<table class="lntable"><tr><td class="lntd">
<pre tabindex="0" class="chroma"><code><span class="lnt">1
</span></code></pre></td>
<td class="lntd">
<pre tabindex="0" class="chroma"><code class="language-shell" data-lang="shell"><span class="line"><span class="cl"><span class="nb">source</span> venv/bin/activate</span></span></code></pre></td></tr></table>
</div>
</div><p>Com isso já temos tudo pronto para começar a instalar nossas bibliotecas e criar nosso código.</p>
<h3 id="instalando-flask-e-começando-a-codar" class="heading-element"><span>Instalando Flask e começando a codar</span>
 <a href="#instalando-flask-e-come%c3%a7ando-a-codar" class="heading-mark">
 <svg class="octicon octicon-link" viewBox="0 0 16 16" version="1.1" width="16" height="16" aria-hidden="true"><path d="m7.775 3.275 1.25-1.25a3.5 3.5 0 1 1 4.95 4.95l-2.5 2.5a3.5 3.5 0 0 1-4.95 0 .751.751 0 0 1 .018-1.042.751.751 0 0 1 1.042-.018 1.998 1.998 0 0 0 2.83 0l2.5-2.5a2.002 2.002 0 0 0-2.83-2.83l-1.25 1.25a.751.751 0 0 1-1.042-.018.751.751 0 0 1-.018-1.042Zm-4.69 9.64a1.998 1.998 0 0 0 2.83 0l1.25-1.25a.751.751 0 0 1 1.042.018.751.751 0 0 1 .018 1.042l-1.25 1.25a3.5 3.5 0 1 1-4.95-4.95l2.5-2.5a3.5 3.5 0 0 1 4.95 0 .751.751 0 0 1-.018 1.042.751.751 0 0 1-1.042.018 1.998 1.998 0 0 0-2.83 0l-2.5 2.5a1.998 1.998 0 0 0 0 2.83Z"></path></svg>
 </a>
</h3><p>Instalando Flask:</p>
<div class="highlight"><div class="chroma">
<table class="lntable"><tr><td class="lntd">
<pre tabindex="0" class="chroma"><code><span class="lnt">1
</span></code></pre></td>
<td class="lntd">
<pre tabindex="0" class="chroma"><code class="language-shell" data-lang="shell"><span class="line"><span class="cl">pip install flask</span></span></code></pre></td></tr></table>
</div>
</div><p>Para o nosso código vamos criar o arquivo <code>app.py</code>. Começaremos importando as bibliotecas que vamos utilizar em nosso código:</p>
<div class="highlight"><div class="chroma">
<table class="lntable"><tr><td class="lntd">
<pre tabindex="0" class="chroma"><code><span class="lnt">1
</span><span class="lnt">2
</span></code></pre></td>
<td class="lntd">
<pre tabindex="0" class="chroma"><code class="language-python" data-lang="python"><span class="line"><span class="cl"><span class="c1"># Importando bibliotecas</span>
</span></span><span class="line"><span class="cl"><span class="kn">from</span> <span class="nn">flask</span> <span class="kn">import</span> <span class="n">Flask</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">jsonify</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">request</span> </span></span></code></pre></td></tr></table>
</div>
</div><p>Após isso precisamos criar nossa aplicação utilizando o Flask:</p>
<div class="highlight"><div class="chroma">
<table class="lntable"><tr><td class="lntd">
<pre tabindex="0" class="chroma"><code><span class="lnt">1
</span><span class="lnt">2
</span></code></pre></td>
<td class="lntd">
<pre tabindex="0" class="chroma"><code class="language-python" data-lang="python"><span class="line"><span class="cl"><span class="c1"># Criar flask app</span>
</span></span><span class="line"><span class="cl"><span class="n">app</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">Flask</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="vm">__name__</span><span class="p">)</span> </span></span></code></pre></td></tr></table>
</div>
</div><p>Agora precisamos criar nossa rota que será acessada e a lógica que ela vai executar quando for chamada:</p>
<div class="highlight"><div class="chroma">
<table class="lntable"><tr><td class="lntd">
<pre tabindex="0" class="chroma"><code><span class="lnt">1
</span><span class="lnt">2
</span><span class="lnt">3
</span><span class="lnt">4
</span><span class="lnt">5
</span></code></pre></td>
<td class="lntd">
<pre tabindex="0" class="chroma"><code class="language-python" data-lang="python"><span class="line"><span class="cl"><span class="c1"># Criação da rota</span>
</span></span><span class="line"><span class="cl"><span class="nd">@app.route</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="s1">&#39;/&#39;</span><span class="p">)</span> 
</span></span><span class="line"><span class="cl"><span class="k">def</span> <span class="nf">home</span><span class="p">():</span> 
</span></span><span class="line"><span class="cl"> <span class="n">data</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="s2">&#34;hello world&#34;</span>
</span></span><span class="line"><span class="cl"> <span class="k">return</span> <span class="n">jsonify</span><span class="p">({</span><span class="s1">&#39;data&#39;</span><span class="p">:</span> <span class="n">data</span><span class="p">})</span> </span></span></code></pre></td></tr></table>
</div>
</div><p>Aqui a lógica é simples, quando a rota for acessada uma variável chamada <code>data</code> receberá uma string e será retornada em um JSON. Agora só nos resta inicializar tudo que foi codificado anteriormente.</p>
<div class="highlight"><div class="chroma">
<table class="lntable"><tr><td class="lntd">
<pre tabindex="0" class="chroma"><code><span class="lnt">1
</span><span class="lnt">2
</span><span class="lnt">3
</span></code></pre></td>
<td class="lntd">
<pre tabindex="0" class="chroma"><code class="language-python" data-lang="python"><span class="line"><span class="cl"><span class="c1"># Inicializando</span>
</span></span><span class="line"><span class="cl"><span class="k">if</span> <span class="vm">__name__</span> <span class="o">==</span> <span class="s1">&#39;__main__&#39;</span><span class="p">:</span> 
</span></span><span class="line"><span class="cl"> <span class="n">app</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">run</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">debug</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="kc">True</span><span class="p">)</span></span></span></code></pre></td></tr></table>
</div>
</div><p>E o arquivo completo fica assim:</p>
<div class="highlight"><div class="chroma">
<table class="lntable"><tr><td class="lntd">
<pre tabindex="0" class="chroma"><code><span class="lnt"> 1
</span><span class="lnt"> 2
</span><span class="lnt"> 3
</span><span class="lnt"> 4
</span><span class="lnt"> 5
</span><span class="lnt"> 6
</span><span class="lnt"> 7
</span><span class="lnt"> 8
</span><span class="lnt"> 9
</span><span class="lnt">10
</span><span class="lnt">11
</span><span class="lnt">12
</span><span class="lnt">13
</span><span class="lnt">14
</span><span class="lnt">15
</span></code></pre></td>
<td class="lntd">
<pre tabindex="0" class="chroma"><code class="language-python" data-lang="python"><span class="line"><span class="cl"><span class="c1"># Importando bibliotecas</span>
</span></span><span class="line"><span class="cl"><span class="kn">from</span> <span class="nn">flask</span> <span class="kn">import</span> <span class="n">Flask</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">jsonify</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">request</span> 
</span></span><span class="line"><span class="cl"> 
</span></span><span class="line"><span class="cl"><span class="c1"># Criar flask app</span>
</span></span><span class="line"><span class="cl"><span class="n">app</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">Flask</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="vm">__name__</span><span class="p">)</span> 
</span></span><span class="line"><span class="cl"> 
</span></span><span class="line"><span class="cl"><span class="c1"># Criação de rotas </span>
</span></span><span class="line"><span class="cl"><span class="nd">@app.route</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="s1">&#39;/&#39;</span><span class="p">)</span> 
</span></span><span class="line"><span class="cl"><span class="k">def</span> <span class="nf">home</span><span class="p">():</span> 
</span></span><span class="line"><span class="cl"> <span class="n">data</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="s2">&#34;hello world&#34;</span>
</span></span><span class="line"><span class="cl"> <span class="k">return</span> <span class="n">jsonify</span><span class="p">({</span><span class="s1">&#39;data&#39;</span><span class="p">:</span> <span class="n">data</span><span class="p">})</span> 
</span></span><span class="line"><span class="cl"> 
</span></span><span class="line"><span class="cl"><span class="c1"># Inicializando</span>
</span></span><span class="line"><span class="cl"><span class="k">if</span> <span class="vm">__name__</span> <span class="o">==</span> <span class="s1">&#39;__main__&#39;</span><span class="p">:</span> 
</span></span><span class="line"><span class="cl"> <span class="n">app</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">run</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">debug</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="kc">True</span><span class="p">)</span></span></span></code></pre></td></tr></table>
</div>
</div><h3 id="rodando-nossa-aplicação" class="heading-element"><span>Rodando nossa aplicação</span>
 <a href="#rodando-nossa-aplica%c3%a7%c3%a3o" class="heading-mark">
 <svg class="octicon octicon-link" viewBox="0 0 16 16" version="1.1" width="16" height="16" aria-hidden="true"><path d="m7.775 3.275 1.25-1.25a3.5 3.5 0 1 1 4.95 4.95l-2.5 2.5a3.5 3.5 0 0 1-4.95 0 .751.751 0 0 1 .018-1.042.751.751 0 0 1 1.042-.018 1.998 1.998 0 0 0 2.83 0l2.5-2.5a2.002 2.002 0 0 0-2.83-2.83l-1.25 1.25a.751.751 0 0 1-1.042-.018.751.751 0 0 1-.018-1.042Zm-4.69 9.64a1.998 1.998 0 0 0 2.83 0l1.25-1.25a.751.751 0 0 1 1.042.018.751.751 0 0 1 .018 1.042l-1.25 1.25a3.5 3.5 0 1 1-4.95-4.95l2.5-2.5a3.5 3.5 0 0 1 4.95 0 .751.751 0 0 1-.018 1.042.751.751 0 0 1-1.042.018 1.998 1.998 0 0 0-2.83 0l-2.5 2.5a1.998 1.998 0 0 0 0 2.83Z"></path></svg>
 </a>
</h3><p>Para rodar nossa aplicação rodaremos o seguinte comando:</p>
<div class="highlight"><div class="chroma">
<table class="lntable"><tr><td class="lntd">
<pre tabindex="0" class="chroma"><code><span class="lnt">1
</span></code></pre></td>
<td class="lntd">
<pre tabindex="0" class="chroma"><code class="language-shell" data-lang="shell"><span class="line"><span class="cl">python app.py</span></span></code></pre></td></tr></table>
</div>
</div><p>Se a saída no terminal for parecida com a imagem abaixo é por que deu tudo certo:</p>
<p><figure><img loading="lazy" src="https://sidneiweber.com.br/criando-api-rest-em-python-com-flask/flask-running.png" alt="Flask rodando" srcset="https://sidneiweber.com.br/criando-api-rest-em-python-com-flask/flask-running.png?size=small, https://sidneiweber.com.br/criando-api-rest-em-python-com-flask/flask-running.png?size=medium 1.5x, https://sidneiweber.com.br/criando-api-rest-em-python-com-flask/flask-running.png?size=large 2x" data-title="Flask rodando" style="--width: 806px;--aspect-ratio: 806 / 254;background: url(/images/loading.min.svg) no-repeat center;" onload="this.title=this.dataset.title;for(const i of ['style', 'data-title','onerror','onload']){this.removeAttribute(i);}this.dataset.lazyloaded='';" onerror="this.title=this.dataset.title;for(const i of ['style', 'data-title','onerror','onload']){this.removeAttribute(i);}"/><figcaption class="image-caption">Flask rodando</figcaption>
 </figure></p>
<p>E para testar é muito simples, podemos executar um curl no endereço localhost e na porta 5000 (porta padrão do flask).</p>
<div class="highlight"><div class="chroma">
<table class="lntable"><tr><td class="lntd">
<pre tabindex="0" class="chroma"><code><span class="lnt">1
</span><span class="lnt">2
</span><span class="lnt">3
</span><span class="lnt">4
</span></code></pre></td>
<td class="lntd">
<pre tabindex="0" class="chroma"><code class="language-shell" data-lang="shell"><span class="line"><span class="cl">➜ curl 127.0.0.1:5000 
</span></span><span class="line"><span class="cl"><span class="o">{</span>
</span></span><span class="line"><span class="cl"> <span class="s2">&#34;data&#34;</span>: <span class="s2">&#34;hello world&#34;</span>
</span></span><span class="line"><span class="cl"><span class="o">}</span></span></span></code></pre></td></tr></table>
</div>
</div><p>Bom, se não ocorreu nenhum erro já está funcionando, mas para não ficarmos em um exemplo tão simples e trivial, vamos adicionar alguma lógica nesse serviço. Vamos criar um serviço que gere números aleatórios em um range solicitado, como se fosse uma API sorteadora de números.</p>
<p>Vamos adicionar algumas novas bibliotecas que iremos utilizar e ajustar a nossa rota principal com o código abaixo:</p>
<div class="highlight"><div class="chroma">
<table class="lntable"><tr><td class="lntd">
<pre tabindex="0" class="chroma"><code><span class="lnt"> 1
</span><span class="lnt"> 2
</span><span class="lnt"> 3
</span><span class="lnt"> 4
</span><span class="lnt"> 5
</span><span class="lnt"> 6
</span><span class="lnt"> 7
</span><span class="lnt"> 8
</span><span class="lnt"> 9
</span><span class="lnt">10
</span><span class="lnt">11
</span><span class="lnt">12
</span><span class="lnt">13
</span><span class="lnt">14
</span><span class="lnt">15
</span><span class="lnt">16
</span><span class="lnt">17
</span><span class="lnt">18
</span><span class="lnt">19
</span><span class="lnt">20
</span><span class="lnt">21
</span><span class="lnt">22
</span></code></pre></td>
<td class="lntd">
<pre tabindex="0" class="chroma"><code class="language-python" data-lang="python"><span class="line"><span class="cl"><span class="c1"># Importando bibliotecas</span>
</span></span><span class="line"><span class="cl"><span class="kn">from</span> <span class="nn">flask</span> <span class="kn">import</span> <span class="n">Flask</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">jsonify</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">request</span>
</span></span><span class="line"><span class="cl"><span class="kn">from</span> <span class="nn">random</span> <span class="kn">import</span> <span class="n">randint</span>
</span></span><span class="line"><span class="cl"><span class="kn">from</span> <span class="nn">datetime</span> <span class="kn">import</span> <span class="n">datetime</span>
</span></span><span class="line"><span class="cl">
</span></span><span class="line"><span class="cl"><span class="c1"># Criar flask app</span>
</span></span><span class="line"><span class="cl"><span class="n">app</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">Flask</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="vm">__name__</span><span class="p">)</span>
</span></span><span class="line"><span class="cl">
</span></span><span class="line"><span class="cl"><span class="nd">@app.route</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="s1">&#39;/&#39;</span><span class="p">)</span>
</span></span><span class="line"><span class="cl"><span class="k">def</span> <span class="nf">home</span><span class="p">():</span>
</span></span><span class="line"><span class="cl"> <span class="n">pessoas</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">request</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">args</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">get</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="s1">&#39;pessoas&#39;</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">default</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="mi">10</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="nb">type</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="nb">int</span><span class="p">)</span>
</span></span><span class="line"><span class="cl"> <span class="n">sorteados</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">request</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">args</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">get</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="s1">&#39;sorteados&#39;</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">default</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="mi">1</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="nb">type</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="nb">int</span><span class="p">)</span>
</span></span><span class="line"><span class="cl"> <span class="n">data</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">datetime</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">now</span><span class="p">()</span>
</span></span><span class="line"><span class="cl"> <span class="n">numbers</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="nb">set</span><span class="p">()</span>
</span></span><span class="line"><span class="cl"> <span class="k">while</span> <span class="nb">len</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">numbers</span><span class="p">)</span> <span class="o">&lt;</span> <span class="n">sorteados</span><span class="p">:</span> <span class="c1"># enough is defined somewhere...</span>
</span></span><span class="line"><span class="cl"> <span class="n">numbers</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">add</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">randint</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="mi">0</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">pessoas</span><span class="p">))</span>
</span></span><span class="line"><span class="cl"> <span class="n">s</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="nb">list</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">numbers</span><span class="p">)</span>
</span></span><span class="line"><span class="cl">
</span></span><span class="line"><span class="cl"> <span class="k">return</span> <span class="n">jsonify</span><span class="p">({</span><span class="s1">&#39;numeros_sorteados&#39;</span><span class="p">:</span> <span class="n">s</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="s1">&#39;data&#39;</span><span class="p">:</span> <span class="n">data</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">strftime</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="s1">&#39;</span><span class="si">%d</span><span class="s1">/%m/%Y %H:%M&#39;</span><span class="p">)})</span>
</span></span><span class="line"><span class="cl">
</span></span><span class="line"><span class="cl"><span class="k">if</span> <span class="vm">__name__</span> <span class="o">==</span> <span class="s1">&#39;__main__&#39;</span><span class="p">:</span>
</span></span><span class="line"><span class="cl"> <span class="n">app</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">run</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">debug</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="kc">True</span><span class="p">)</span></span></span></code></pre></td></tr></table>
</div>
</div><p>Vamos testar novamente, por padrão será sorteado somente um número de 1 a 10, podemos passar também valores específicos como verá nos exemplos abaixo:</p>
<div class="highlight"><div class="chroma">
<table class="lntable"><tr><td class="lntd">
<pre tabindex="0" class="chroma"><code><span class="lnt"> 1
</span><span class="lnt"> 2
</span><span class="lnt"> 3
</span><span class="lnt"> 4
</span><span class="lnt"> 5
</span><span class="lnt"> 6
</span><span class="lnt"> 7
</span><span class="lnt"> 8
</span><span class="lnt"> 9
</span><span class="lnt">10
</span><span class="lnt">11
</span><span class="lnt">12
</span><span class="lnt">13
</span><span class="lnt">14
</span><span class="lnt">15
</span><span class="lnt">16
</span><span class="lnt">17
</span><span class="lnt">18
</span><span class="lnt">19
</span><span class="lnt">20
</span><span class="lnt">21
</span><span class="lnt">22
</span><span class="lnt">23
</span></code></pre></td>
<td class="lntd">
<pre tabindex="0" class="chroma"><code class="language-shell" data-lang="shell"><span class="line"><span class="cl">➜ curl 127.0.0.1:5000
</span></span><span class="line"><span class="cl"><span class="o">{</span>
</span></span><span class="line"><span class="cl"> <span class="s2">&#34;data&#34;</span>: <span class="s2">&#34;07/03/2024 15:27&#34;</span>,
</span></span><span class="line"><span class="cl"> <span class="s2">&#34;numeros_sorteados&#34;</span>: <span class="o">[</span>
</span></span><span class="line"><span class="cl"> <span class="m">10</span>
</span></span><span class="line"><span class="cl"> <span class="o">]</span>
</span></span><span class="line"><span class="cl"><span class="o">}</span>
</span></span><span class="line"><span class="cl">➜ curl <span class="s1">&#39;127.0.0.1:5000/?pessoas=100&amp;sorteados=3&#39;</span>
</span></span><span class="line"><span class="cl"><span class="o">{</span>
</span></span><span class="line"><span class="cl"> <span class="s2">&#34;data&#34;</span>: <span class="s2">&#34;07/03/2024 15:29&#34;</span>,
</span></span><span class="line"><span class="cl"> <span class="s2">&#34;numeros_sorteados&#34;</span>: <span class="o">[</span>
</span></span><span class="line"><span class="cl"> 33,
</span></span><span class="line"><span class="cl"> 6,
</span></span><span class="line"><span class="cl"> <span class="m">71</span>
</span></span><span class="line"><span class="cl"> <span class="o">]</span>
</span></span><span class="line"><span class="cl"><span class="o">}</span>
</span></span><span class="line"><span class="cl">➜ curl <span class="s1">&#39;127.0.0.1:5000/?pessoas=100&amp;sorteados=1&#39;</span>
</span></span><span class="line"><span class="cl"><span class="o">{</span>
</span></span><span class="line"><span class="cl"> <span class="s2">&#34;data&#34;</span>: <span class="s2">&#34;07/03/2024 15:29&#34;</span>,
</span></span><span class="line"><span class="cl"> <span class="s2">&#34;numeros_sorteados&#34;</span>: <span class="o">[</span>
</span></span><span class="line"><span class="cl"> <span class="m">30</span>
</span></span><span class="line"><span class="cl"> <span class="o">]</span>
</span></span><span class="line"><span class="cl"><span class="o">}</span></span></span></code></pre></td></tr></table>
</div>
</div><p>Se o retorno foi um JSON com os números sorteados está feito, temos nossa primeira API REST escrita, simples ainda, mas que logo usaremos para ir avançando para exemplificar alguns conceitos que podem nos ajudar no dia a dia do mundo Devops, Cloud e Observabilidade.</p>
<p><a href="https://www.hostinger.com.br/tutoriais/api-restful"target="_blank" rel="external nofollow noopener noreferrer">https://www.hostinger.com.br/tutoriais/api-restful</a></p>
<p><a href="https://flask.palletsprojects.com/en/2.2.x/tutorial/"target="_blank" rel="external nofollow noopener noreferrer">https://flask.palletsprojects.com/en/2.2.x/tutorial/</a></p>

item.title: Um pouco sobre SLA, SLI e SLO
item.description:
<img src="https://sidneiweber.com.br/um-pouco-sobre-sla-sli-slo/featured-image.png" alt="featured image" referrerpolicy="no-referrer"><h2 id="introdução" class="heading-element"><span>Introdução</span>
 <a href="#introdu%c3%a7%c3%a3o" class="heading-mark">
 <svg class="octicon octicon-link" viewBox="0 0 16 16" version="1.1" width="16" height="16" aria-hidden="true"><path d="m7.775 3.275 1.25-1.25a3.5 3.5 0 1 1 4.95 4.95l-2.5 2.5a3.5 3.5 0 0 1-4.95 0 .751.751 0 0 1 .018-1.042.751.751 0 0 1 1.042-.018 1.998 1.998 0 0 0 2.83 0l2.5-2.5a2.002 2.002 0 0 0-2.83-2.83l-1.25 1.25a.751.751 0 0 1-1.042-.018.751.751 0 0 1-.018-1.042Zm-4.69 9.64a1.998 1.998 0 0 0 2.83 0l1.25-1.25a.751.751 0 0 1 1.042.018.751.751 0 0 1 .018 1.042l-1.25 1.25a3.5 3.5 0 1 1-4.95-4.95l2.5-2.5a3.5 3.5 0 0 1 4.95 0 .751.751 0 0 1-.018 1.042.751.751 0 0 1-1.042.018 1.998 1.998 0 0 0-2.83 0l-2.5 2.5a1.998 1.998 0 0 0 0 2.83Z"></path></svg>
 </a>
</h2><p>Algumas métricas são importantes para entender como nossos serviços estão performando mas também existem métricas que nos dão uma visão sobre a confiabilidade e disponibilidade desses serviços. Entre elas estão o SLI e SLO, que vamos entender um pouco mais nesse texto.</p>
<p>Primeiramente é necessário entender que são métricas e dados importantes para medir a confiabilidade dos serviços através da observabilidade, um dos principais pilares de SRE (Site Reliability Engineering). O conceito de engenharia de confiabilidade foi criado pela equipe de engenharia do Google.</p>
<h2 id="exemplo-prático" class="heading-element"><span>Exemplo prático</span>
 <a href="#exemplo-pr%c3%a1tico" class="heading-mark">
 <svg class="octicon octicon-link" viewBox="0 0 16 16" version="1.1" width="16" height="16" aria-hidden="true"><path d="m7.775 3.275 1.25-1.25a3.5 3.5 0 1 1 4.95 4.95l-2.5 2.5a3.5 3.5 0 0 1-4.95 0 .751.751 0 0 1 .018-1.042.751.751 0 0 1 1.042-.018 1.998 1.998 0 0 0 2.83 0l2.5-2.5a2.002 2.002 0 0 0-2.83-2.83l-1.25 1.25a.751.751 0 0 1-1.042-.018.751.751 0 0 1-.018-1.042Zm-4.69 9.64a1.998 1.998 0 0 0 2.83 0l1.25-1.25a.751.751 0 0 1 1.042.018.751.751 0 0 1 .018 1.042l-1.25 1.25a3.5 3.5 0 1 1-4.95-4.95l2.5-2.5a3.5 3.5 0 0 1 4.95 0 .751.751 0 0 1-.018 1.042.751.751 0 0 1-1.042.018 1.998 1.998 0 0 0-2.83 0l-2.5 2.5a1.998 1.998 0 0 0 0 2.83Z"></path></svg>
 </a>
</h2><p>Vamos supor que o SLI seja a LATÊNCIA de uma API, o SLO seja de ter 97% das requisições abaixo de 1s nos últimos 30 dias, e o SLA firmado com o cliente é de responder em até 1s, 93% das requisições.</p>
<h2 id="sli-service-level-indicator" class="heading-element"><span>SLI (Service Level Indicator)</span>
 <a href="#sli-service-level-indicator" class="heading-mark">
 <svg class="octicon octicon-link" viewBox="0 0 16 16" version="1.1" width="16" height="16" aria-hidden="true"><path d="m7.775 3.275 1.25-1.25a3.5 3.5 0 1 1 4.95 4.95l-2.5 2.5a3.5 3.5 0 0 1-4.95 0 .751.751 0 0 1 .018-1.042.751.751 0 0 1 1.042-.018 1.998 1.998 0 0 0 2.83 0l2.5-2.5a2.002 2.002 0 0 0-2.83-2.83l-1.25 1.25a.751.751 0 0 1-1.042-.018.751.751 0 0 1-.018-1.042Zm-4.69 9.64a1.998 1.998 0 0 0 2.83 0l1.25-1.25a.751.751 0 0 1 1.042.018.751.751 0 0 1 .018 1.042l-1.25 1.25a3.5 3.5 0 1 1-4.95-4.95l2.5-2.5a3.5 3.5 0 0 1 4.95 0 .751.751 0 0 1-.018 1.042.751.751 0 0 1-1.042.018 1.998 1.998 0 0 0-2.83 0l-2.5 2.5a1.998 1.998 0 0 0 0 2.83Z"></path></svg>
 </a>
</h2><p>São métricas que podem ser medidas (quantificáveis) em relação aos serviços, e que caso não estejam em bons números podem impactar a performance do serviço. Ex:</p>
<ul>
<li>Latência</li>
<li>Taxa de erros</li>
<li>Saturação</li>
<li>Disponibilidade</li>
</ul>
<p>Nem toda métrica pode se tornar um SLI, devemos entender as métricas que impactam a experiência do usuário ou o desempenho do sistema.</p>
<h2 id="slo-service-level-object" class="heading-element"><span>SLO (Service Level Object)</span>
 <a href="#slo-service-level-object" class="heading-mark">
 <svg class="octicon octicon-link" viewBox="0 0 16 16" version="1.1" width="16" height="16" aria-hidden="true"><path d="m7.775 3.275 1.25-1.25a3.5 3.5 0 1 1 4.95 4.95l-2.5 2.5a3.5 3.5 0 0 1-4.95 0 .751.751 0 0 1 .018-1.042.751.751 0 0 1 1.042-.018 1.998 1.998 0 0 0 2.83 0l2.5-2.5a2.002 2.002 0 0 0-2.83-2.83l-1.25 1.25a.751.751 0 0 1-1.042-.018.751.751 0 0 1-.018-1.042Zm-4.69 9.64a1.998 1.998 0 0 0 2.83 0l1.25-1.25a.751.751 0 0 1 1.042.018.751.751 0 0 1 .018 1.042l-1.25 1.25a3.5 3.5 0 1 1-4.95-4.95l2.5-2.5a3.5 3.5 0 0 1 4.95 0 .751.751 0 0 1-.018 1.042.751.751 0 0 1-1.042.018 1.998 1.998 0 0 0-2.83 0l-2.5 2.5a1.998 1.998 0 0 0 0 2.83Z"></path></svg>
 </a>
</h2><p>Com o SLO podemos medir a maturidade dos serviços (internamente), é um valor na qual nos comprometemos em manter para não corromper a qualidade dos serviços e ambientes e também podendo dar direcionando nas ações. É importante que cada service level objective seja <strong>atingível, repetitivo, mensurável, compreensível, significante e controlável</strong>, além de conter as possíveis gratificações e penalidades previamente definidas para ambas as partes envolvidas.</p>
<p>É de suma importância que a organização esteja comprometida em manter os bons níveis do serviço e que o SLO não seja comprometido. Alguns exemplos:</p>
<ul>
<li>Disponibilidade:
<ul>
<li>SLI: Quantidade de erros em relação a quantidade de requests/processamentos.</li>
<li>SLO: 98% de requests/processamentos com sucesso.</li>
</ul>
</li>
<li>Latência:
<ul>
<li>SLI: Tempo de resposta ou tempo de processamento</li>
<li>SLO: 98% das requisições ou processamentos abaixo de X milissegundos.</li>
</ul>
</li>
</ul>
<h3 id="como-ter-sucesso-com-sli-e-slo" class="heading-element"><span>Como ter sucesso com SLI e SLO</span>
 <a href="#como-ter-sucesso-com-sli-e-slo" class="heading-mark">
 <svg class="octicon octicon-link" viewBox="0 0 16 16" version="1.1" width="16" height="16" aria-hidden="true"><path d="m7.775 3.275 1.25-1.25a3.5 3.5 0 1 1 4.95 4.95l-2.5 2.5a3.5 3.5 0 0 1-4.95 0 .751.751 0 0 1 .018-1.042.751.751 0 0 1 1.042-.018 1.998 1.998 0 0 0 2.83 0l2.5-2.5a2.002 2.002 0 0 0-2.83-2.83l-1.25 1.25a.751.751 0 0 1-1.042-.018.751.751 0 0 1-.018-1.042Zm-4.69 9.64a1.998 1.998 0 0 0 2.83 0l1.25-1.25a.751.751 0 0 1 1.042.018.751.751 0 0 1 .018 1.042l-1.25 1.25a3.5 3.5 0 1 1-4.95-4.95l2.5-2.5a3.5 3.5 0 0 1 4.95 0 .751.751 0 0 1-.018 1.042.751.751 0 0 1-1.042.018 1.998 1.998 0 0 0-2.83 0l-2.5 2.5a1.998 1.998 0 0 0 0 2.83Z"></path></svg>
 </a>
</h3><ul>
<li>Considerar expectativas dos clientes (internos e externos);</li>
<li>Deixar acordos de SLO bem claros;
<ul>
<li>O SLO deve ser visto como um recurso para garantir a melhoria contínua;</li>
</ul>
</li>
<li>Escolher bem as métricas para compor o SLI;</li>
</ul>
<h2 id="sla-service-level-agreement" class="heading-element"><span>SLA (Service Level Agreement)</span>
 <a href="#sla-service-level-agreement" class="heading-mark">
 <svg class="octicon octicon-link" viewBox="0 0 16 16" version="1.1" width="16" height="16" aria-hidden="true"><path d="m7.775 3.275 1.25-1.25a3.5 3.5 0 1 1 4.95 4.95l-2.5 2.5a3.5 3.5 0 0 1-4.95 0 .751.751 0 0 1 .018-1.042.751.751 0 0 1 1.042-.018 1.998 1.998 0 0 0 2.83 0l2.5-2.5a2.002 2.002 0 0 0-2.83-2.83l-1.25 1.25a.751.751 0 0 1-1.042-.018.751.751 0 0 1-.018-1.042Zm-4.69 9.64a1.998 1.998 0 0 0 2.83 0l1.25-1.25a.751.751 0 0 1 1.042.018.751.751 0 0 1 .018 1.042l-1.25 1.25a3.5 3.5 0 1 1-4.95-4.95l2.5-2.5a3.5 3.5 0 0 1 4.95 0 .751.751 0 0 1-.018 1.042.751.751 0 0 1-1.042.018 1.998 1.998 0 0 0-2.83 0l-2.5 2.5a1.998 1.998 0 0 0 0 2.83Z"></path></svg>
 </a>
</h2><p>Ainda temos o SLA que é um acordo entre quem está entregando o serviço e o usuário final, garantindo um certo nível de serviço (SLO).</p>
<p>O não cumprimento desse acordo (SLA), pode gerar consequências, dentre elas podemos citar a penalidade financeira, gerando descontos por exemplo para o cliente afetado.</p>
<p>Para mais informações sobre o assunto podemos conferir no material do Google <a href="https://sre.google/"target="_blank" rel="external nofollow noopener noreferrer">https://sre.google/</a></p>
<p><a href="https://www.atlassian.com/br/incident-management/kpis/sla-vs-slo-vs-sli"target="_blank" rel="external nofollow noopener noreferrer">https://www.atlassian.com/br/incident-management/kpis/sla-vs-slo-vs-sli</a></p>

item.title: Como criar um cluster kubernetes EKS na AWS com eksctl
item.description:
<img src="https://sidneiweber.com.br/como-criar-cluster-kubernetes-eks-na-aws-com-eksctl/featured-image.gif" alt="featured image" referrerpolicy="no-referrer"><h2 id="introdução" class="heading-element"><span>Introdução</span>
 <a href="#introdu%c3%a7%c3%a3o" class="heading-mark">
 <svg class="octicon octicon-link" viewBox="0 0 16 16" version="1.1" width="16" height="16" aria-hidden="true"><path d="m7.775 3.275 1.25-1.25a3.5 3.5 0 1 1 4.95 4.95l-2.5 2.5a3.5 3.5 0 0 1-4.95 0 .751.751 0 0 1 .018-1.042.751.751 0 0 1 1.042-.018 1.998 1.998 0 0 0 2.83 0l2.5-2.5a2.002 2.002 0 0 0-2.83-2.83l-1.25 1.25a.751.751 0 0 1-1.042-.018.751.751 0 0 1-.018-1.042Zm-4.69 9.64a1.998 1.998 0 0 0 2.83 0l1.25-1.25a.751.751 0 0 1 1.042.018.751.751 0 0 1 .018 1.042l-1.25 1.25a3.5 3.5 0 1 1-4.95-4.95l2.5-2.5a3.5 3.5 0 0 1 4.95 0 .751.751 0 0 1-.018 1.042.751.751 0 0 1-1.042.018 1.998 1.998 0 0 0-2.83 0l-2.5 2.5a1.998 1.998 0 0 0 0 2.83Z"></path></svg>
 </a>
</h2><p>Após o último post sobre Kubernetes criando um cluster localmente, continuaremos a saga, mas agora criando um cluster Kubernetes na AWS, em um cenário um pouco mais próxima da realidade. Para criar um cluster kubernetes na AWS utilizaremos uma ferramenta chamada eksctl.</p>
<blockquote><p>eksctl é uma ferramenta CLI simples para criar e gerenciar clusters no EKS – serviço Kubernetes gerenciado da Amazon para EC2. Está escrito em Go, usa CloudFormation, foi criado pela Weaveworks e aceita contribuições da comunidade.</p>
</blockquote><h2 id="instalando-o-eksctl" class="heading-element"><span>Instalando o eksctl</span>
 <a href="#instalando-o-eksctl" class="heading-mark">
 <svg class="octicon octicon-link" viewBox="0 0 16 16" version="1.1" width="16" height="16" aria-hidden="true"><path d="m7.775 3.275 1.25-1.25a3.5 3.5 0 1 1 4.95 4.95l-2.5 2.5a3.5 3.5 0 0 1-4.95 0 .751.751 0 0 1 .018-1.042.751.751 0 0 1 1.042-.018 1.998 1.998 0 0 0 2.83 0l2.5-2.5a2.002 2.002 0 0 0-2.83-2.83l-1.25 1.25a.751.751 0 0 1-1.042-.018.751.751 0 0 1-.018-1.042Zm-4.69 9.64a1.998 1.998 0 0 0 2.83 0l1.25-1.25a.751.751 0 0 1 1.042.018.751.751 0 0 1 .018 1.042l-1.25 1.25a3.5 3.5 0 1 1-4.95-4.95l2.5-2.5a3.5 3.5 0 0 1 4.95 0 .751.751 0 0 1-.018 1.042.751.751 0 0 1-1.042.018 1.998 1.998 0 0 0-2.83 0l-2.5 2.5a1.998 1.998 0 0 0 0 2.83Z"></path></svg>
 </a>
</h2><h3 id="linux" class="heading-element"><span>Linux</span>
 <a href="#linux" class="heading-mark">
 <svg class="octicon octicon-link" viewBox="0 0 16 16" version="1.1" width="16" height="16" aria-hidden="true"><path d="m7.775 3.275 1.25-1.25a3.5 3.5 0 1 1 4.95 4.95l-2.5 2.5a3.5 3.5 0 0 1-4.95 0 .751.751 0 0 1 .018-1.042.751.751 0 0 1 1.042-.018 1.998 1.998 0 0 0 2.83 0l2.5-2.5a2.002 2.002 0 0 0-2.83-2.83l-1.25 1.25a.751.751 0 0 1-1.042-.018.751.751 0 0 1-.018-1.042Zm-4.69 9.64a1.998 1.998 0 0 0 2.83 0l1.25-1.25a.751.751 0 0 1 1.042.018.751.751 0 0 1 .018 1.042l-1.25 1.25a3.5 3.5 0 1 1-4.95-4.95l2.5-2.5a3.5 3.5 0 0 1 4.95 0 .751.751 0 0 1-.018 1.042.751.751 0 0 1-1.042.018 1.998 1.998 0 0 0-2.83 0l-2.5 2.5a1.998 1.998 0 0 0 0 2.83Z"></path></svg>
 </a>
</h3><div class="highlight"><div class="chroma">
<table class="lntable"><tr><td class="lntd">
<pre tabindex="0" class="chroma"><code><span class="lnt"> 1
</span><span class="lnt"> 2
</span><span class="lnt"> 3
</span><span class="lnt"> 4
</span><span class="lnt"> 5
</span><span class="lnt"> 6
</span><span class="lnt"> 7
</span><span class="lnt"> 8
</span><span class="lnt"> 9
</span><span class="lnt">10
</span><span class="lnt">11
</span><span class="lnt">12
</span></code></pre></td>
<td class="lntd">
<pre tabindex="0" class="chroma"><code class="language-shell" data-lang="shell"><span class="line"><span class="cl"><span class="c1"># for ARM systems, set ARCH to: `arm64`, `armv6` or `armv7`</span>
</span></span><span class="line"><span class="cl"><span class="nv">ARCH</span><span class="o">=</span>amd64
</span></span><span class="line"><span class="cl"><span class="nv">PLATFORM</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="k">$(</span>uname -s<span class="k">)</span>_<span class="nv">$ARCH</span>
</span></span><span class="line"><span class="cl">
</span></span><span class="line"><span class="cl">curl -sLO <span class="s2">&#34;https://github.com/eksctl-io/eksctl/releases/latest/download/eksctl_</span><span class="nv">$PLATFORM</span><span class="s2">.tar.gz&#34;</span>
</span></span><span class="line"><span class="cl">
</span></span><span class="line"><span class="cl"><span class="c1"># (Optional) Verify checksum</span>
</span></span><span class="line"><span class="cl">curl -sL <span class="s2">&#34;https://github.com/eksctl-io/eksctl/releases/latest/download/eksctl_checksums.txt&#34;</span> <span class="p">|</span> grep <span class="nv">$PLATFORM</span> <span class="p">|</span> sha256sum --check
</span></span><span class="line"><span class="cl">
</span></span><span class="line"><span class="cl">tar -xzf eksctl_<span class="nv">$PLATFORM</span>.tar.gz -C /tmp <span class="o">&amp;&amp;</span> rm eksctl_<span class="nv">$PLATFORM</span>.tar.gz
</span></span><span class="line"><span class="cl">
</span></span><span class="line"><span class="cl">sudo mv /tmp/eksctl /usr/local/bin</span></span></code></pre></td></tr></table>
</div>
</div><h3 id="windows-e-mac" class="heading-element"><span>Windows e Mac</span>
 <a href="#windows-e-mac" class="heading-mark">
 <svg class="octicon octicon-link" viewBox="0 0 16 16" version="1.1" width="16" height="16" aria-hidden="true"><path d="m7.775 3.275 1.25-1.25a3.5 3.5 0 1 1 4.95 4.95l-2.5 2.5a3.5 3.5 0 0 1-4.95 0 .751.751 0 0 1 .018-1.042.751.751 0 0 1 1.042-.018 1.998 1.998 0 0 0 2.83 0l2.5-2.5a2.002 2.002 0 0 0-2.83-2.83l-1.25 1.25a.751.751 0 0 1-1.042-.018.751.751 0 0 1-.018-1.042Zm-4.69 9.64a1.998 1.998 0 0 0 2.83 0l1.25-1.25a.751.751 0 0 1 1.042.018.751.751 0 0 1 .018 1.042l-1.25 1.25a3.5 3.5 0 1 1-4.95-4.95l2.5-2.5a3.5 3.5 0 0 1 4.95 0 .751.751 0 0 1-.018 1.042.751.751 0 0 1-1.042.018 1.998 1.998 0 0 0-2.83 0l-2.5 2.5a1.998 1.998 0 0 0 0 2.83Z"></path></svg>
 </a>
</h3><div class="highlight"><div class="chroma">
<table class="lntable"><tr><td class="lntd">
<pre tabindex="0" class="chroma"><code><span class="lnt">1
</span></code></pre></td>
<td class="lntd">
<pre tabindex="0" class="chroma"><code class="language-powershell" data-lang="powershell"><span class="line"><span class="cl"><span class="n">choco</span> <span class="n">install</span> <span class="n">eksctl</span></span></span></code></pre></td></tr></table>
</div>
</div><p><a href="https://eksctl.io/installation/#for-windows"target="_blank" rel="external nofollow noopener noreferrer">https://eksctl.io/installation/#for-windows</a></p>
<div class="highlight"><div class="chroma">
<table class="lntable"><tr><td class="lntd">
<pre tabindex="0" class="chroma"><code><span class="lnt">1
</span><span class="lnt">2
</span></code></pre></td>
<td class="lntd">
<pre tabindex="0" class="chroma"><code class="language-shell" data-lang="shell"><span class="line"><span class="cl">brew tap weaveworks/tap
</span></span><span class="line"><span class="cl">brew install weaveworks/tap/eksctl</span></span></code></pre></td></tr></table>
</div>
</div><p><a href="https://eksctl.io/installation/#for-macos"target="_blank" rel="external nofollow noopener noreferrer">https://eksctl.io/installation/#for-macos</a></p>
<p>Vamos testar se está tudo funcionando:</p>
<div class="highlight"><div class="chroma">
<table class="lntable"><tr><td class="lntd">
<pre tabindex="0" class="chroma"><code><span class="lnt">1
</span><span class="lnt">2
</span><span class="lnt">3
</span><span class="lnt">4
</span></code></pre></td>
<td class="lntd">
<pre tabindex="0" class="chroma"><code class="language-shell" data-lang="shell"><span class="line"><span class="cl">➜ eksctl info
</span></span><span class="line"><span class="cl">eksctl version: 0.167.0
</span></span><span class="line"><span class="cl">kubectl version: v1.28.2
</span></span><span class="line"><span class="cl">OS: linux</span></span></code></pre></td></tr></table>
</div>
</div><p>Com a ferramenta eksctl precisamos também que as <a href="https://docs.aws.amazon.com/pt_br/cli/latest/userguide/cli-configure-envvars.html"target="_blank" rel="external nofollow noopener noreferrer">credenciais da AWS</a> já estejam configuradas, a partir dai podemos começar a utilizar a ferramenta. Temos duas formas que criar um cluster EKS, utilizando somente a <em>linha de comando</em>, passando todos os parâmetros necessários ou com um <em>arquivo YAML de configuração</em> para definirmos como queremos criar o nosso cluster.</p>
<h2 id="criando-cluster-via-linha-de-comando" class="heading-element"><span>Criando cluster via linha de comando</span>
 <a href="#criando-cluster-via-linha-de-comando" class="heading-mark">
 <svg class="octicon octicon-link" viewBox="0 0 16 16" version="1.1" width="16" height="16" aria-hidden="true"><path d="m7.775 3.275 1.25-1.25a3.5 3.5 0 1 1 4.95 4.95l-2.5 2.5a3.5 3.5 0 0 1-4.95 0 .751.751 0 0 1 .018-1.042.751.751 0 0 1 1.042-.018 1.998 1.998 0 0 0 2.83 0l2.5-2.5a2.002 2.002 0 0 0-2.83-2.83l-1.25 1.25a.751.751 0 0 1-1.042-.018.751.751 0 0 1-.018-1.042Zm-4.69 9.64a1.998 1.998 0 0 0 2.83 0l1.25-1.25a.751.751 0 0 1 1.042.018.751.751 0 0 1 .018 1.042l-1.25 1.25a3.5 3.5 0 1 1-4.95-4.95l2.5-2.5a3.5 3.5 0 0 1 4.95 0 .751.751 0 0 1-.018 1.042.751.751 0 0 1-1.042.018 1.998 1.998 0 0 0-2.83 0l-2.5 2.5a1.998 1.998 0 0 0 0 2.83Z"></path></svg>
 </a>
</h2><p>Primeiro podemos testar se já temos algum cluster criado:</p>
<div class="highlight"><div class="chroma">
<table class="lntable"><tr><td class="lntd">
<pre tabindex="0" class="chroma"><code><span class="lnt">1
</span><span class="lnt">2
</span></code></pre></td>
<td class="lntd">
<pre tabindex="0" class="chroma"><code class="language-shell" data-lang="shell"><span class="line"><span class="cl">➜ eksctl get cluster 
</span></span><span class="line"><span class="cl">No clusters found</span></span></code></pre></td></tr></table>
</div>
</div><p>Como podemos ver ainda não temos nenhum cluster criado. Vamos então criar um cluster simples utilizando a linha de comando:</p>
<div class="highlight"><div class="chroma">
<table class="lntable"><tr><td class="lntd">
<pre tabindex="0" class="chroma"><code><span class="lnt"> 1
</span><span class="lnt"> 2
</span><span class="lnt"> 3

</span><span class="lnt">14

</span><span class="lnt">19

</span><span class="lnt">21

</span><span class="lnt">25

</span><span class="lnt">27
</span><span class="lnt">28
</span></code></pre></td>
<td class="lntd">
<pre tabindex="0" class="chroma"><code class="language-shell" data-lang="shell"><span class="line"><span class="cl">➜ eksctl create cluster
</span></span><span class="line"><span class="cl"><span class="o">[</span>ℹ<span class="o">]</span> using region us-west-2
</span></span><span class="line"><span class="cl"><span class="o">[</span>ℹ<span class="o">]</span> setting availability zones to <span class="o">[</span>us-west-2a us-west-2c us-west-2b<span class="o">]</span>
</span></span><span class="line"><span class="cl"><span class="o">[</span>ℹ<span class="o">]</span> subnets <span class="k">for</span> us-west-2a - public:192.168.0.0/19 private:192.168.96.0/19
</span></span><span class="line"><span class="cl"><span class="o">[</span>ℹ<span class="o">]</span> subnets <span class="k">for</span> us-west-2c - public:192.168.32.0/19 private:192.168.128.0/19
</span></span><span class="line"><span class="cl"><span class="o">[</span>ℹ<span class="o">]</span> subnets <span class="k">for</span> us-west-2b - public:192.168.64.0/19 private:192.168.160.0/19
</span></span><span class="line"><span class="cl"><span class="o">[</span>ℹ<span class="o">]</span> nodegroup <span class="s2">&#34;ng-98b3b83a&#34;</span> will use <span class="s2">&#34;ami-05ecac759c81e0b0c&#34;</span> <span class="o">[</span>AmazonLinux2/1.11<span class="o">]</span>
</span></span><span class="line"><span class="cl"><span class="o">[</span>ℹ<span class="o">]</span> creating EKS cluster <span class="s2">&#34;floral-unicorn-1540567338&#34;</span> in <span class="s2">&#34;us-west-2&#34;</span> region
</span></span><span class="line"><span class="cl"><span class="o">[</span>ℹ<span class="o">]</span> will create <span class="m">2</span> separate CloudFormation stacks <span class="k">for</span> cluster itself and the initial nodegroup
</span></span><span class="line"><span class="cl"><span class="o">[</span>ℹ<span class="o">]</span> <span class="k">if</span> you encounter any issues, check CloudFormation console or try <span class="s1">&#39;eksctl utils describe-stacks --region=us-west-2 --cluster=floral-unicorn-1540567338&#39;</span>
</span></span><span class="line"><span class="cl"><span class="o">[</span>ℹ<span class="o">]</span> <span class="m">2</span> sequential tasks: <span class="o">{</span> create cluster control plane <span class="s2">&#34;floral-unicorn-1540567338&#34;</span>, create nodegroup <span class="s2">&#34;ng-98b3b83a&#34;</span> <span class="o">}</span>
</span></span><span class="line"><span class="cl"><span class="o">[</span>ℹ<span class="o">]</span> building cluster stack <span class="s2">&#34;eksctl-floral-unicorn-1540567338-cluster&#34;</span>
</span></span><span class="line"><span class="cl"><span class="o">[</span>ℹ<span class="o">]</span> deploying stack <span class="s2">&#34;eksctl-floral-unicorn-1540567338-cluster&#34;</span>
</span></span><span class="line"><span class="cl"><span class="o">[</span>ℹ<span class="o">]</span> building nodegroup stack <span class="s2">&#34;eksctl-floral-unicorn-1540567338-nodegroup-ng-98b3b83a&#34;</span>
</span></span><span class="line"><span class="cl"><span class="o">[</span>ℹ<span class="o">]</span> --nodes-min<span class="o">=</span><span class="m">2</span> was <span class="nb">set</span> automatically <span class="k">for</span> nodegroup ng-98b3b83a
</span></span><span class="line"><span class="cl"><span class="o">[</span>ℹ<span class="o">]</span> --nodes-max<span class="o">=</span><span class="m">2</span> was <span class="nb">set</span> automatically <span class="k">for</span> nodegroup ng-98b3b83a
</span></span><span class="line"><span class="cl"><span class="o">[</span>ℹ<span class="o">]</span> deploying stack <span class="s2">&#34;eksctl-floral-unicorn-1540567338-nodegroup-ng-98b3b83a&#34;</span>
</span></span><span class="line"><span class="cl"><span class="o">[</span>✔<span class="o">]</span> all EKS cluster resource <span class="k">for</span> <span class="s2">&#34;floral-unicorn-1540567338&#34;</span> had been created
</span></span><span class="line"><span class="cl"><span class="o">[</span>✔<span class="o">]</span> saved kubeconfig as <span class="s2">&#34;~/.kube/config&#34;</span>
</span></span><span class="line"><span class="cl"><span class="o">[</span>ℹ<span class="o">]</span> adding role <span class="s2">&#34;arn:aws:iam::376248598259:role/eksctl-ridiculous-sculpture-15547-NodeInstanceRole-1F3IHNVD03Z74&#34;</span> to auth ConfigMap
</span></span><span class="line"><span class="cl"><span class="o">[</span>ℹ<span class="o">]</span> nodegroup <span class="s2">&#34;ng-98b3b83a&#34;</span> has <span class="m">1</span> node<span class="o">(</span>s<span class="o">)</span>
</span></span><span class="line"><span class="cl"><span class="o">[</span>ℹ<span class="o">]</span> node <span class="s2">&#34;ip-192-168-64-220.us-west-2.compute.internal&#34;</span> is not ready
</span></span><span class="line"><span class="cl"><span class="o">[</span>ℹ<span class="o">]</span> waiting <span class="k">for</span> at least <span class="m">2</span> node<span class="o">(</span>s<span class="o">)</span> to become ready in <span class="s2">&#34;ng-98b3b83a&#34;</span>
</span></span><span class="line"><span class="cl"><span class="o">[</span>ℹ<span class="o">]</span> nodegroup <span class="s2">&#34;ng-98b3b83a&#34;</span> has <span class="m">2</span> node<span class="o">(</span>s<span class="o">)</span>
</span></span><span class="line"><span class="cl"><span class="o">[</span>ℹ<span class="o">]</span> node <span class="s2">&#34;ip-192-168-64-220.us-west-2.compute.internal&#34;</span> is ready
</span></span><span class="line"><span class="cl"><span class="o">[</span>ℹ<span class="o">]</span> node <span class="s2">&#34;ip-192-168-8-135.us-west-2.compute.internal&#34;</span> is ready
</span></span><span class="line"><span class="cl"><span class="o">[</span>ℹ<span class="o">]</span> kubectl <span class="nb">command</span> should work with <span class="s2">&#34;~/.kube/config&#34;</span>, try <span class="s1">&#39;kubectl get nodes&#39;</span>
</span></span><span class="line"><span class="cl"><span class="o">[</span>✔<span class="o">]</span> EKS cluster <span class="s2">&#34;floral-unicorn-1540567338&#34;</span> in <span class="s2">&#34;us-west-2&#34;</span> region is ready</span></span></code></pre></td></tr></table>
</div>
</div><p>Como não passamos nenhum parâmetro o cluster será criado com os valores padrões:</p>
<ul>
<li>Nome gerado automaticamente</li>
<li>Dois worker nodes de tamanho <code>m5.large</code></li>
<li>Usa o AWS <a href="https://github.com/awslabs/amazon-eks-ami"target="_blank" rel="external nofollow noopener noreferrer">EKS AMI</a> oficial</li>
<li>Região<code>us-west-2</code></li>
<li>Uma VPC dedicada</li>
</ul>
<p>Podemos também personalizar nosso cluster personalizando os parâmetros passados, como, por exemplo, personalizar nome, quantidade de nós do cluster e especificar a versão do kubernetes utilizada.</p>
<div class="highlight"><div class="chroma">
<table class="lntable"><tr><td class="lntd">
<pre tabindex="0" class="chroma"><code><span class="lnt">1
</span></code></pre></td>
<td class="lntd">
<pre tabindex="0" class="chroma"><code class="language-shell" data-lang="shell"><span class="line"><span class="cl">eksctl create cluster --name<span class="o">=</span>cluster-dev --nodes<span class="o">=</span><span class="m">4</span> --version<span class="o">=</span>1.28</span></span></code></pre></td></tr></table>
</div>
</div><p>Para saber quais parâmetros que podemos utilizar, podemos usar o comando abaixo:</p>
<div class="highlight"><div class="chroma">
<table class="lntable"><tr><td class="lntd">
<pre tabindex="0" class="chroma"><code><span class="lnt">1
</span></code></pre></td>
<td class="lntd">
<pre tabindex="0" class="chroma"><code class="language-shell" data-lang="shell"><span class="line"><span class="cl">➜ eksctl create cluster --help</span></span></code></pre></td></tr></table>
</div>
</div><h2 id="criando-cluster-via-arquivo-de-configuração" class="heading-element"><span>Criando cluster via arquivo de configuração</span>
 <a href="#criando-cluster-via-arquivo-de-configura%c3%a7%c3%a3o" class="heading-mark">
 <svg class="octicon octicon-link" viewBox="0 0 16 16" version="1.1" width="16" height="16" aria-hidden="true"><path d="m7.775 3.275 1.25-1.25a3.5 3.5 0 1 1 4.95 4.95l-2.5 2.5a3.5 3.5 0 0 1-4.95 0 .751.751 0 0 1 .018-1.042.751.751 0 0 1 1.042-.018 1.998 1.998 0 0 0 2.83 0l2.5-2.5a2.002 2.002 0 0 0-2.83-2.83l-1.25 1.25a.751.751 0 0 1-1.042-.018.751.751 0 0 1-.018-1.042Zm-4.69 9.64a1.998 1.998 0 0 0 2.83 0l1.25-1.25a.751.751 0 0 1 1.042.018.751.751 0 0 1 .018 1.042l-1.25 1.25a3.5 3.5 0 1 1-4.95-4.95l2.5-2.5a3.5 3.5 0 0 1 4.95 0 .751.751 0 0 1-.018 1.042.751.751 0 0 1-1.042.018 1.998 1.998 0 0 0-2.83 0l-2.5 2.5a1.998 1.998 0 0 0 0 2.83Z"></path></svg>
 </a>
</h2><p>Outra forma de criar um cluster é utilizando um arquivo de configuração. Eu acredito ser a maneira ideal, pois podemos compartilhar o arquivo ou manter-lô em um repositório como o github, por exemplo. No nosso exemplo estamos criando um cluster na região us-east-1 com dois node groups de tamanhos e capacidades diferentes. Daremos o nome para o arquivo de cluster.yaml:</p>
<div class="highlight"><div class="chroma">
<table class="lntable"><tr><td class="lntd">
<pre tabindex="0" class="chroma"><code><span class="lnt"> 1
</span><span class="lnt"> 2
</span><span class="lnt"> 3
</span><span class="lnt"> 4
</span><span class="lnt"> 5
</span><span class="lnt"> 6
</span><span class="lnt"> 7
</span><span class="lnt"> 8
</span><span class="lnt"> 9
</span><span class="lnt">10
</span><span class="lnt">11
</span><span class="lnt">12
</span><span class="lnt">13
</span><span class="lnt">14
</span></code></pre></td>
<td class="lntd">
<pre tabindex="0" class="chroma"><code class="language-yaml" data-lang="yaml"><span class="line"><span class="cl"><span class="nt">apiVersion</span><span class="p">:</span><span class="w"> </span><span class="l">eksctl.io/v1alpha5</span><span class="w">
</span></span></span><span class="line"><span class="cl"><span class="w"></span><span class="nt">kind</span><span class="p">:</span><span class="w"> </span><span class="l">ClusterConfig</span><span class="w">
</span></span></span><span class="line"><span class="cl"><span class="w">
</span></span></span><span class="line"><span class="cl"><span class="w"></span><span class="nt">metadata</span><span class="p">:</span><span class="w">
</span></span></span><span class="line"><span class="cl"><span class="w"> </span><span class="nt">name</span><span class="p">:</span><span class="w"> </span><span class="l">basic-cluster</span><span class="w">
</span></span></span><span class="line"><span class="cl"><span class="w"> </span><span class="nt">region</span><span class="p">:</span><span class="w"> </span><span class="l">us-east-1</span><span class="w">
</span></span></span><span class="line"><span class="cl"><span class="w">
</span></span></span><span class="line"><span class="cl"><span class="w"></span><span class="nt">nodeGroups</span><span class="p">:</span><span class="w">
</span></span></span><span class="line"><span class="cl"><span class="w"> </span>- <span class="nt">name</span><span class="p">:</span><span class="w"> </span><span class="l">ng-1</span><span class="w">
</span></span></span><span class="line"><span class="cl"><span class="w"> </span><span class="nt">instanceType</span><span class="p">:</span><span class="w"> </span><span class="l">m5.large</span><span class="w">
</span></span></span><span class="line"><span class="cl"><span class="w"> </span><span class="nt">desiredCapacity</span><span class="p">:</span><span class="w"> </span><span class="m">10</span><span class="w">
</span></span></span><span class="line"><span class="cl"><span class="w"> </span>- <span class="nt">name</span><span class="p">:</span><span class="w"> </span><span class="l">ng-2</span><span class="w">
</span></span></span><span class="line"><span class="cl"><span class="w"> </span><span class="nt">instanceType</span><span class="p">:</span><span class="w"> </span><span class="l">m5.xlarge</span><span class="w">
</span></span></span><span class="line"><span class="cl"><span class="w"> </span><span class="nt">desiredCapacity</span><span class="p">:</span><span class="w"> </span><span class="m">2</span></span></span></code></pre></td></tr></table>
</div>
</div><p>Para criar o cluster só precisamos apontar o arquivo de configuração que criamos na etapa anterior:</p>
<div class="highlight"><div class="chroma">
<table class="lntable"><tr><td class="lntd">
<pre tabindex="0" class="chroma"><code><span class="lnt">1
</span></code></pre></td>
<td class="lntd">
<pre tabindex="0" class="chroma"><code class="language-shell" data-lang="shell"><span class="line"><span class="cl">eksctl create cluster -f cluster.yaml</span></span></code></pre></td></tr></table>
</div>
</div><h2 id="gerenciando-o-cluster" class="heading-element"><span>Gerenciando o cluster</span>
 <a href="#gerenciando-o-cluster" class="heading-mark">
 <svg class="octicon octicon-link" viewBox="0 0 16 16" version="1.1" width="16" height="16" aria-hidden="true"><path d="m7.775 3.275 1.25-1.25a3.5 3.5 0 1 1 4.95 4.95l-2.5 2.5a3.5 3.5 0 0 1-4.95 0 .751.751 0 0 1 .018-1.042.751.751 0 0 1 1.042-.018 1.998 1.998 0 0 0 2.83 0l2.5-2.5a2.002 2.002 0 0 0-2.83-2.83l-1.25 1.25a.751.751 0 0 1-1.042-.018.751.751 0 0 1-.018-1.042Zm-4.69 9.64a1.998 1.998 0 0 0 2.83 0l1.25-1.25a.751.751 0 0 1 1.042.018.751.751 0 0 1 .018 1.042l-1.25 1.25a3.5 3.5 0 1 1-4.95-4.95l2.5-2.5a3.5 3.5 0 0 1 4.95 0 .751.751 0 0 1-.018 1.042.751.751 0 0 1-1.042.018 1.998 1.998 0 0 0-2.83 0l-2.5 2.5a1.998 1.998 0 0 0 0 2.83Z"></path></svg>

item.title: 3 maneiras de iniciar um cluster Kubernetes localmente
item.description:
<img src="https://sidneiweber.com.br/3-maneiras-iniciar-cluster-kubernetes-localmente/featured-image.png" alt="featured image" referrerpolicy="no-referrer"><h2 id="anchor-introdução" class="heading-element"><span>&#x2693; Introdução</span>
 <a href="#anchor-introdu%c3%a7%c3%a3o" class="heading-mark">
 <svg class="octicon octicon-link" viewBox="0 0 16 16" version="1.1" width="16" height="16" aria-hidden="true"><path d="m7.775 3.275 1.25-1.25a3.5 3.5 0 1 1 4.95 4.95l-2.5 2.5a3.5 3.5 0 0 1-4.95 0 .751.751 0 0 1 .018-1.042.751.751 0 0 1 1.042-.018 1.998 1.998 0 0 0 2.83 0l2.5-2.5a2.002 2.002 0 0 0-2.83-2.83l-1.25 1.25a.751.751 0 0 1-1.042-.018.751.751 0 0 1-.018-1.042Zm-4.69 9.64a1.998 1.998 0 0 0 2.83 0l1.25-1.25a.751.751 0 0 1 1.042.018.751.751 0 0 1 .018 1.042l-1.25 1.25a3.5 3.5 0 1 1-4.95-4.95l2.5-2.5a3.5 3.5 0 0 1 4.95 0 .751.751 0 0 1-.018 1.042.751.751 0 0 1-1.042.018 1.998 1.998 0 0 0-2.83 0l-2.5 2.5a1.998 1.998 0 0 0 0 2.83Z"></path></svg>
 </a>
</h2><p>O Kubernetes se tornou uma das plataformas de orquestração de containers mais utilizada no mundo. Existem diversos fatores positivos e negativos no uso do Kubernetes no processo de desenvolvimento, implantação e gerenciamento de aplicações.</p>
<ul>
<li>Kubernetes oferece uma orquestração avançada, permitindo que as aplicações cresçam conforme a demanda.</li>
<li>Ele permite também abstrair a infraestrutura, ou seja, se a aplicação roda em um cluster Kubernetes, muito provavelmente roda em qualquer outro cluster de mesma versão.</li>
<li>E vem se tornado um padrão de mercado dentro das grandes organizações, diminuindo um pouco a complexidade quando um funcionário passa de uma empresa para outra.</li>
</ul>
<h2 id="arrow_forward-kind" class="heading-element"><span>&#x25b6;&#xfe0f; Kind</span>
 <a href="#arrow_forward-kind" class="heading-mark">
 <svg class="octicon octicon-link" viewBox="0 0 16 16" version="1.1" width="16" height="16" aria-hidden="true"><path d="m7.775 3.275 1.25-1.25a3.5 3.5 0 1 1 4.95 4.95l-2.5 2.5a3.5 3.5 0 0 1-4.95 0 .751.751 0 0 1 .018-1.042.751.751 0 0 1 1.042-.018 1.998 1.998 0 0 0 2.83 0l2.5-2.5a2.002 2.002 0 0 0-2.83-2.83l-1.25 1.25a.751.751 0 0 1-1.042-.018.751.751 0 0 1-.018-1.042Zm-4.69 9.64a1.998 1.998 0 0 0 2.83 0l1.25-1.25a.751.751 0 0 1 1.042.018.751.751 0 0 1 .018 1.042l-1.25 1.25a3.5 3.5 0 1 1-4.95-4.95l2.5-2.5a3.5 3.5 0 0 1 4.95 0 .751.751 0 0 1-.018 1.042.751.751 0 0 1-1.042.018 1.998 1.998 0 0 0-2.83 0l-2.5 2.5a1.998 1.998 0 0 0 0 2.83Z"></path></svg>
 </a>
</h2><h3 id="sobre" class="heading-element"><span>Sobre</span>
 <a href="#sobre" class="heading-mark">
 <svg class="octicon octicon-link" viewBox="0 0 16 16" version="1.1" width="16" height="16" aria-hidden="true"><path d="m7.775 3.275 1.25-1.25a3.5 3.5 0 1 1 4.95 4.95l-2.5 2.5a3.5 3.5 0 0 1-4.95 0 .751.751 0 0 1 .018-1.042.751.751 0 0 1 1.042-.018 1.998 1.998 0 0 0 2.83 0l2.5-2.5a2.002 2.002 0 0 0-2.83-2.83l-1.25 1.25a.751.751 0 0 1-1.042-.018.751.751 0 0 1-.018-1.042Zm-4.69 9.64a1.998 1.998 0 0 0 2.83 0l1.25-1.25a.751.751 0 0 1 1.042.018.751.751 0 0 1 .018 1.042l-1.25 1.25a3.5 3.5 0 1 1-4.95-4.95l2.5-2.5a3.5 3.5 0 0 1 4.95 0 .751.751 0 0 1-.018 1.042.751.751 0 0 1-1.042.018 1.998 1.998 0 0 0-2.83 0l-2.5 2.5a1.998 1.998 0 0 0 0 2.83Z"></path></svg>
 </a>
</h3><p>Kind é uma ferramenta para executar clusters locais do Kubernetes usando “nós” de contêiner Docker. Kind foi projetado principalmente para testar o próprio Kubernetes, mas pode ser usado para desenvolvimento local ou CI.</p>
<h3 id="instalação" class="heading-element"><span>Instalação</span>
 <a href="#instala%c3%a7%c3%a3o" class="heading-mark">
 <svg class="octicon octicon-link" viewBox="0 0 16 16" version="1.1" width="16" height="16" aria-hidden="true"><path d="m7.775 3.275 1.25-1.25a3.5 3.5 0 1 1 4.95 4.95l-2.5 2.5a3.5 3.5 0 0 1-4.95 0 .751.751 0 0 1 .018-1.042.751.751 0 0 1 1.042-.018 1.998 1.998 0 0 0 2.83 0l2.5-2.5a2.002 2.002 0 0 0-2.83-2.83l-1.25 1.25a.751.751 0 0 1-1.042-.018.751.751 0 0 1-.018-1.042Zm-4.69 9.64a1.998 1.998 0 0 0 2.83 0l1.25-1.25a.751.751 0 0 1 1.042.018.751.751 0 0 1 .018 1.042l-1.25 1.25a3.5 3.5 0 1 1-4.95-4.95l2.5-2.5a3.5 3.5 0 0 1 4.95 0 .751.751 0 0 1-.018 1.042.751.751 0 0 1-1.042.018 1.998 1.998 0 0 0-2.83 0l-2.5 2.5a1.998 1.998 0 0 0 0 2.83Z"></path></svg>
 </a>
</h3><p>Para usar o kind precisamos já ter o docker instalado. Caso ainda não tenho, pode seguir o tutorial a seguir <a href="https://docs.docker.com/engine/install/"target="_blank" rel="external nofollow noopener noreferrer">https://docs.docker.com/engine/install/</a></p>
<h4 id="linux" class="heading-element"><span>Linux</span>
 <a href="#linux" class="heading-mark">
 <svg class="octicon octicon-link" viewBox="0 0 16 16" version="1.1" width="16" height="16" aria-hidden="true"><path d="m7.775 3.275 1.25-1.25a3.5 3.5 0 1 1 4.95 4.95l-2.5 2.5a3.5 3.5 0 0 1-4.95 0 .751.751 0 0 1 .018-1.042.751.751 0 0 1 1.042-.018 1.998 1.998 0 0 0 2.83 0l2.5-2.5a2.002 2.002 0 0 0-2.83-2.83l-1.25 1.25a.751.751 0 0 1-1.042-.018.751.751 0 0 1-.018-1.042Zm-4.69 9.64a1.998 1.998 0 0 0 2.83 0l1.25-1.25a.751.751 0 0 1 1.042.018.751.751 0 0 1 .018 1.042l-1.25 1.25a3.5 3.5 0 1 1-4.95-4.95l2.5-2.5a3.5 3.5 0 0 1 4.95 0 .751.751 0 0 1-.018 1.042.751.751 0 0 1-1.042.018 1.998 1.998 0 0 0-2.83 0l-2.5 2.5a1.998 1.998 0 0 0 0 2.83Z"></path></svg>
 </a>
</h4><div class="highlight"><div class="chroma">
<table class="lntable"><tr><td class="lntd">
<pre tabindex="0" class="chroma"><code><span class="lnt">1
</span><span class="lnt">2
</span><span class="lnt">3
</span></code></pre></td>
<td class="lntd">
<pre tabindex="0" class="chroma"><code class="language-shell" data-lang="shell"><span class="line"><span class="cl"><span class="o">[</span> <span class="k">$(</span>uname -m<span class="k">)</span> <span class="o">=</span> x86_64 <span class="o">]</span> <span class="o">&amp;&amp;</span> curl -Lo ./kind https://kind.sigs.k8s.io/dl/v0.20.0/kind-linux-amd64
</span></span><span class="line"><span class="cl">chmod +x ./kind
</span></span><span class="line"><span class="cl">sudo mv ./kind /usr/local/bin/kind</span></span></code></pre></td></tr></table>
</div>
</div><h4 id="mac" class="heading-element"><span>Mac</span>
 <a href="#mac" class="heading-mark">
 <svg class="octicon octicon-link" viewBox="0 0 16 16" version="1.1" width="16" height="16" aria-hidden="true"><path d="m7.775 3.275 1.25-1.25a3.5 3.5 0 1 1 4.95 4.95l-2.5 2.5a3.5 3.5 0 0 1-4.95 0 .751.751 0 0 1 .018-1.042.751.751 0 0 1 1.042-.018 1.998 1.998 0 0 0 2.83 0l2.5-2.5a2.002 2.002 0 0 0-2.83-2.83l-1.25 1.25a.751.751 0 0 1-1.042-.018.751.751 0 0 1-.018-1.042Zm-4.69 9.64a1.998 1.998 0 0 0 2.83 0l1.25-1.25a.751.751 0 0 1 1.042.018.751.751 0 0 1 .018 1.042l-1.25 1.25a3.5 3.5 0 1 1-4.95-4.95l2.5-2.5a3.5 3.5 0 0 1 4.95 0 .751.751 0 0 1-.018 1.042.751.751 0 0 1-1.042.018 1.998 1.998 0 0 0-2.83 0l-2.5 2.5a1.998 1.998 0 0 0 0 2.83Z"></path></svg>
 </a>
</h4><div class="highlight"><div class="chroma">
<table class="lntable"><tr><td class="lntd">
<pre tabindex="0" class="chroma"><code><span class="lnt">1
</span><span class="lnt">2
</span><span class="lnt">3
</span><span class="lnt">4
</span><span class="lnt">5
</span><span class="lnt">6
</span></code></pre></td>
<td class="lntd">
<pre tabindex="0" class="chroma"><code class="language-shell" data-lang="shell"><span class="line"><span class="cl"><span class="c1"># For Intel Macs</span>
</span></span><span class="line"><span class="cl"><span class="o">[</span> <span class="k">$(</span>uname -m<span class="k">)</span> <span class="o">=</span> x86_64 <span class="o">]</span> <span class="o">&amp;&amp;</span> curl -Lo ./kind https://kind.sigs.k8s.io/dl/v0.20.0/kind-darwin-amd64
</span></span><span class="line"><span class="cl"><span class="c1"># For M1 / ARM Macs</span>
</span></span><span class="line"><span class="cl"><span class="o">[</span> <span class="k">$(</span>uname -m<span class="k">)</span> <span class="o">=</span> arm64 <span class="o">]</span> <span class="o">&amp;&amp;</span> curl -Lo ./kind https://kind.sigs.k8s.io/dl/v0.20.0/kind-darwin-arm64
</span></span><span class="line"><span class="cl">chmod +x ./kind
</span></span><span class="line"><span class="cl">mv ./kind /some-dir-in-your-PATH/kind</span></span></code></pre></td></tr></table>
</div>
</div><h4 id="windows" class="heading-element"><span>Windows</span>
 <a href="#windows" class="heading-mark">
 <svg class="octicon octicon-link" viewBox="0 0 16 16" version="1.1" width="16" height="16" aria-hidden="true"><path d="m7.775 3.275 1.25-1.25a3.5 3.5 0 1 1 4.95 4.95l-2.5 2.5a3.5 3.5 0 0 1-4.95 0 .751.751 0 0 1 .018-1.042.751.751 0 0 1 1.042-.018 1.998 1.998 0 0 0 2.83 0l2.5-2.5a2.002 2.002 0 0 0-2.83-2.83l-1.25 1.25a.751.751 0 0 1-1.042-.018.751.751 0 0 1-.018-1.042Zm-4.69 9.64a1.998 1.998 0 0 0 2.83 0l1.25-1.25a.751.751 0 0 1 1.042.018.751.751 0 0 1 .018 1.042l-1.25 1.25a3.5 3.5 0 1 1-4.95-4.95l2.5-2.5a3.5 3.5 0 0 1 4.95 0 .751.751 0 0 1-.018 1.042.751.751 0 0 1-1.042.018 1.998 1.998 0 0 0-2.83 0l-2.5 2.5a1.998 1.998 0 0 0 0 2.83Z"></path></svg>
 </a>
</h4><div class="highlight"><div class="chroma">
<table class="lntable"><tr><td class="lntd">
<pre tabindex="0" class="chroma"><code><span class="lnt">1
</span><span class="lnt">2
</span></code></pre></td>
<td class="lntd">
<pre tabindex="0" class="chroma"><code class="language-powershell" data-lang="powershell"><span class="line"><span class="cl"><span class="n">curl</span><span class="p">.</span><span class="py">exe</span> <span class="n">-Lo</span> <span class="nb">kind-windows</span><span class="n">-amd64</span><span class="p">.</span><span class="py">exe</span> <span class="n">https</span><span class="err">:</span><span class="p">//</span><span class="n">kind</span><span class="p">.</span><span class="py">sigs</span><span class="p">.</span><span class="py">k8s</span><span class="p">.</span><span class="n">io</span><span class="p">/</span><span class="n">dl</span><span class="p">/</span><span class="n">v0</span><span class="p">.</span><span class="py">20</span><span class="p">.</span><span class="mf">0</span><span class="p">/</span><span class="nb">kind-windows</span><span class="n">-amd64</span>
</span></span><span class="line"><span class="cl"><span class="nb">Move-Item</span> <span class="p">.\</span><span class="nb">kind-windows</span><span class="n">-amd64</span><span class="p">.</span><span class="py">exe</span> <span class="n">c:</span><span class="p">\</span><span class="nb">some-dir</span><span class="n">-in-your-PATH</span><span class="p">\</span><span class="n">kind</span><span class="p">.</span><span class="n">exe</span></span></span></code></pre></td></tr></table>
</div>
</div><h3 id="exemplos" class="heading-element"><span>Exemplos</span>
 <a href="#exemplos" class="heading-mark">
 <svg class="octicon octicon-link" viewBox="0 0 16 16" version="1.1" width="16" height="16" aria-hidden="true"><path d="m7.775 3.275 1.25-1.25a3.5 3.5 0 1 1 4.95 4.95l-2.5 2.5a3.5 3.5 0 0 1-4.95 0 .751.751 0 0 1 .018-1.042.751.751 0 0 1 1.042-.018 1.998 1.998 0 0 0 2.83 0l2.5-2.5a2.002 2.002 0 0 0-2.83-2.83l-1.25 1.25a.751.751 0 0 1-1.042-.018.751.751 0 0 1-.018-1.042Zm-4.69 9.64a1.998 1.998 0 0 0 2.83 0l1.25-1.25a.751.751 0 0 1 1.042.018.751.751 0 0 1 .018 1.042l-1.25 1.25a3.5 3.5 0 1 1-4.95-4.95l2.5-2.5a3.5 3.5 0 0 1 4.95 0 .751.751 0 0 1-.018 1.042.751.751 0 0 1-1.042.018 1.998 1.998 0 0 0-2.83 0l-2.5 2.5a1.998 1.998 0 0 0 0 2.83Z"></path></svg>
 </a>
</h3><p>Para criarmos um cluster utilizando o Kind:</p>
<div class="highlight"><div class="chroma">
<table class="lntable"><tr><td class="lntd">
<pre tabindex="0" class="chroma"><code><span class="lnt">1
</span><span class="lnt">2
</span><span class="lnt">3
</span></code></pre></td>
<td class="lntd">
<pre tabindex="0" class="chroma"><code class="language-shell" data-lang="shell"><span class="line"><span class="cl">kind create cluster <span class="c1"># Criar cluster simples</span>
</span></span><span class="line"><span class="cl">kind create cluster --name kind-2 <span class="c1"># Criar cluster especificando o nome</span>
</span></span><span class="line"><span class="cl">kind get clusters <span class="c1"># Listar clusters</span></span></span></code></pre></td></tr></table>
</div>
</div><p>Para deletarmos um cluster:</p>
<div class="highlight"><div class="chroma">
<table class="lntable"><tr><td class="lntd">
<pre tabindex="0" class="chroma"><code><span class="lnt">1
</span></code></pre></td>
<td class="lntd">
<pre tabindex="0" class="chroma"><code class="language-shell" data-lang="shell"><span class="line"><span class="cl">kind delete cluster</span></span></code></pre></td></tr></table>
</div>
</div><p>Para criarmos um cluster com mais de um node, podemos criar um arquivo de configuração e utilizá-lo como parâmetro. O arquivo pode ser parecido com o abaixo, onde definimos um node como controle plane e dois nodes como workers:</p>
<div class="highlight"><div class="chroma">
<table class="lntable"><tr><td class="lntd">
<pre tabindex="0" class="chroma"><code><span class="lnt">1
</span><span class="lnt">2
</span><span class="lnt">3
</span><span class="lnt">4
</span><span class="lnt">5
</span><span class="lnt">6
</span></code></pre></td>
<td class="lntd">
<pre tabindex="0" class="chroma"><code class="language-yaml" data-lang="yaml"><span class="line"><span class="cl"><span class="nt">kind</span><span class="p">:</span><span class="w"> </span><span class="l">Cluster</span><span class="w">
</span></span></span><span class="line"><span class="cl"><span class="w"></span><span class="nt">apiVersion</span><span class="p">:</span><span class="w"> </span><span class="l">kind.x-k8s.io/v1alpha4</span><span class="w">
</span></span></span><span class="line"><span class="cl"><span class="w"></span><span class="nt">nodes</span><span class="p">:</span><span class="w">
</span></span></span><span class="line"><span class="cl"><span class="w"></span>- <span class="nt">role</span><span class="p">:</span><span class="w"> </span><span class="l">control-plane</span><span class="w">
</span></span></span><span class="line"><span class="cl"><span class="w"></span>- <span class="nt">role</span><span class="p">:</span><span class="w"> </span><span class="l">worker</span><span class="w">
</span></span></span><span class="line"><span class="cl"><span class="w"></span>- <span class="nt">role</span><span class="p">:</span><span class="w"> </span><span class="l">worker</span></span></span></code></pre></td></tr></table>
</div>
</div><p>Com o arquivo criado, podemos executar o comando:</p>
<div class="highlight"><div class="chroma">
<table class="lntable"><tr><td class="lntd">

 </a>
</h3><p>k3d é um wrapper leve para executar k3s (distribuição mínima do Kubernetes do Rancher Lab) no docker. O k3d torna muito fácil a criação de clusters k3s de nó único e de vários nós no docker, por exemplo, para o desenvolvimento local no Kubernetes.
Nota: k3d é um projeto conduzido pela comunidade, mas não é um produto oficial do Rancher (SUSE).</p>

</h3><p>Criando cluster com k3d:</p>
<div class="highlight"><div class="chroma">
<table class="lntable"><tr><td class="lntd">

</span><span class="lnt">2
</span></code></pre></td>

<pre tabindex="0" class="chroma"><code class="language-shell" data-lang="shell"><span class="line"><span class="cl">k3d cluster create mycluster
</span></span><span class="line"><span class="cl">kubectl get nodes</span></span></code></pre></td></tr></table>
</div>
</div><p>Assim como no kind, também podemos criar clusters a partir de um arquivo de configuração. Segue um exemplo onde criaremos também um cluster com um node para control plane e dois nodes workers:</p>
<div class="highlight"><div class="chroma">
<table class="lntable"><tr><td class="lntd">
<pre tabindex="0" class="chroma"><code><span class="lnt">1
</span><span class="lnt">2
</span><span class="lnt">3
</span><span class="lnt">4
</span></code></pre></td>
<td class="lntd">
<pre tabindex="0" class="chroma"><code class="language-yaml" data-lang="yaml"><span class="line"><span class="cl"><span class="nt">apiVersion</span><span class="p">:</span><span class="w"> </span><span class="l">k3d.io/v1alpha5</span><span class="w">
</span></span></span><span class="line"><span class="cl"><span class="w"></span><span class="nt">kind</span><span class="p">:</span><span class="w"> </span><span class="l">Simple</span><span class="w">
</span></span></span><span class="line"><span class="cl"><span class="w"></span><span class="nt">servers</span><span class="p">:</span><span class="w"> </span><span class="m">1</span><span class="w">
</span></span></span><span class="line"><span class="cl"><span class="w"></span><span class="nt">agents</span><span class="p">:</span><span class="w"> </span><span class="m">2</span></span></span></code></pre></td></tr></table>
</div>
</div><p>E para executar a criação utilizando o arquivo:</p>
<div class="highlight"><div class="chroma">
<table class="lntable"><tr><td class="lntd">
<pre tabindex="0" class="chroma"><code><span class="lnt">1
</span></code></pre></td>
<td class="lntd">
<pre tabindex="0" class="chroma"><code class="language-shell" data-lang="shell"><span class="line"><span class="cl">k3d cluster create --config example-config.yaml</span></span></code></pre></td></tr></table>
</div>

</h3><p>O Minikube configura rapidamente um cluster Kubernetes local no macOS, Linux e Windows.
Acredito que o Minikube seja a opção mais conhecida e utilizada até hoje. Um dois maiores diferenciais do Minikube é poder criar o cluster usando diversos provisionadores. Além do docker como as outras ferramentas, também podemos utilizar <a href="https://www.qemu.org"target="_blank" rel="external nofollow noopener noreferrer">Qemu</a>, <a href="https://www.virtualbox.org"target="_blank" rel="external nofollow noopener noreferrer">VirtualBox</a>, dentre outros.</p>
